title: Ticket #3822: param substitution does not honor per-daemon overrides
description:
When a param references another param, it does not honor per-daemon overrides. so if the param system contains: 
foo = 1
bar = $(foo) + 1
master.foo = 2
the result of param("bar") should be "1 + 1" genericaly and "2 + 1"= for master, but the result is ="1 + 1" for everyone.
remarks:
2013-Jul-30 09:09:41 by johnkn:
this seems to be the underlying cause for #3196

2013-Jul-30 09:11:24 by johnkn:
note that [37028] fixes the problem for per-daemon overrides, but not for local-name overrides. A more complete fix is needed. also the fix should be cherry-picked back to 8.0 branch for inclusion in 8.0.2

2013-Aug-18 21:24:55 by bbockelm:
Hi TJ,

This commit introduced an infinite loop at our site with our production configs. It appears that this evaluates differently now: 

FOO = baz
SCHEDD.FOO = $(FOO), bar

Previously, this evaluated to "baz, bar"; now, this causes an infinite loop.

Brian

2013-Aug-19 10:38:42 by tannenba:
^^^ This exact config that Brian posted should be added as a regression test for the config system. Would be trivial to add a few regression tests in this area, just add some entries into a config file and run condor_config_val.

2013-Aug-21 11:04:34 by johnkn:
with [37299], param parsing will now handle 
FOO = bar
MASTER.FOO = $(FOO), baz
in a way that is consistent with v8.0.x for the master and for other daemons if there is no prior definition of MASTER.FOO.

However 

FOO = bar
MASTER.FOO = mike
MASTER.FOO = $(FOO), baz
will produce different results for the master between 8.1.1 and prior versions.

for the 8.1.1 master, param("FOO") will return "mike, baz"

for the 8.0.x master, param("FOO") will return "bar, baz"

2013-Aug-27 13:57:55 by bt:
The more compound testing which led to an infinate loop has been added as a third check(making 4 counting basic 'it runs' check ) in job_basic_param_config_check.run.
